definition: study tirelessly (idiom, from Analects)
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
(negative prefix)/not/no
to loathe
study tirelessly, teach with endless enthusiasm (idiom, from Analects)
pinyin: xue2 er2 bu4 yan4 , hui4 ren2 bu4 juan4

sentences.english: May you never stop learning for as long as you live.
sentences.chinese: 愿的追求宵衣旰食，愿永远学而不厌。

sentences.english: All these support his spirit of "learning insatiably".
sentences.chinese: 凡此都说明孔子自己“学而不厌”的精神。

definition: instructing with tireless zeal (idiom, from Analects)
study tirelessly, teach with endless enthusiasm (idiom, from Analects)
pinyin: xue2 er2 bu4 yan4 , hui4 ren2 bu4 juan4

definition: so dedicated as to forget one's meals (idiom)
not feel ashamed to ask and learn from one's subordinates
to learn is to know one's ignorance (the Book of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4])
pinyin: xue2 ran2 hou4 zhi1 bu4 zu2

definition: receptive as an echoing canyon (idiom); modest and open-minded
sea of learning, no horizon (idiom); no limits to what one still has to learn/ars longa, vita brevis
mastery of study lies in diligence (idiom). You can only master a subject by assiduous study./Excellence in work is only possible with diligence./Practice makes perfect.
no end to learning (idiom); There's always something new to study./You live and learn.
studious/diligent in study
lit. the leather binding (of the bamboo scroll) has broken three times/fig. to study diligently
lit. always with a book in hand (idiom)/fig. (of a student or scholar) diligent and hardworking
to choose the right course and follow it (idiom)
To learn without thinking is confusing, to think without learning is dangerous (Confucius)
pinyin: xue2 er2 bu4 si1 ze2 wang3 , si1 er2 bu4 xue2 ze2 dai4
related.word: 学而不思则罔，思而不学则殆

definition: diligent and sociable (idiom); meticulous in work and dealing cheerfully with one's colleagues
vigorously pursuing knowledge, while scrupulously abiding by the rules of decorum (idiom)
